content: A self-titled album released by what legendary British rock band in 1969 is often referred to as the 'White Album'?

That would be "The Beatles," often referred to as the Fab Four. Their self-titled album, released in 1968—not 1969, by the way—is commonly known as the "White Album" due to its plain white cover. It's one of their most iconic works, featuring a wide range of songs that showcase their musical versatility.
